abstract: Concerns grow in Liberia over number of people who may have been exposed to country's first Ebola case in more than two weeks; patient lived in one-bathroom house with 52 others and sold food at school attended by nearly 2,000 students.
lead_paragraph: The patient, a street vendor who lived in a one-bathroom house shared with 52 others in a Monrovia suburb, had sold food last week at a school where more than 1,900 students are enrolled.

headline.main: Exposure Concerns Grow in Liberia After Diagnosis of First Ebola Case in Weeks
headline.print_headline: Exposure Concerns Grow in Liberia After Diagnosis of First Ebola Case in Weeks

snippet: The patient, a street vendor who lived in a one-bathroom house shared with 52 others in a Monrovia suburb, had sold food last week at a school where more than 1,900 students are enrolled.
